str2: Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Warm, tepid; of persons: lukewarm. From chlio; tepid.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
Boiling hot; met: fervent. From zeo; boiled, i.e. calid.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
Cool, cold; fig: cold-hearted. From psuchos; chilly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
To vomit forth. Of uncertain affinity; to vomit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.
